intro: Clidemia berbiceana, commonly known as the Caribbean flame bush, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, showy white to pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Its rapid growth and ability to form thickets make it an important component of the local ecosystem.
